page.title: 01N.W.NEWCASTLE.
page.content: This area is mainly{residential. Kenton,Coxlodge and Fawdon have been housing growth areas particularly in the last 30 years.There are marked {contrasts}between areas of relative affluence and those of great hardship. Houses built in the 1930's are located near the Town Moor. In the 50's and 60's{large council estates}were built in Kenton,Montagu, Newbiggin Hall and Fawdon following slum clearance in Byker and Scotswood.Terraced and semi- detached houses were built along with several blocks of flats. { Large private housing estates}have been built in the last 20 years to the North and West adjacent to the surrounding farming belt,reflecting the move towards wider home ownership. Also there are{two industrial estates and at Kenton Bar several{government {buildings}and the{Crown Courts.
